definitions.text: a return on a shot that seemed impossible to reach and would normally have resulted in a point for the opponent
come into the possession of something concrete or abstract
examples: She got a lot of paintings from her uncle
They acquired a new pet
Get your results the next day
Get permission to take a few days off from work

definitions.text: enter or assume a certain state or condition
examples: He became annoyed when he heard the bad news
It must be getting more serious
her face went red with anger
She went into ecstasy
Get going!

definitions.text: cause to move; cause to be in a certain position or condition
examples: He got his squad on the ball
This let me in for a big surprise
He got a girl into trouble

definitions.text: receive a specified treatment (abstract)
examples: These aspects of civilization do not find expression or receive an interpretation
His movie received a good review
I got nothing but trouble for my good intentions

definitions.text: reach a destination; arrive by movement or progress
examples: She arrived home at 7 o'clock
She didn't get to Chicago until after midnight

definitions.text: go or come after and bring or take back
examples: Get me those books over there, please
Could you bring the wine?
The dog fetched the hat

definitions.text: go through (mental or physical states or experiences)
examples: get an idea
experience vertigo
get nauseous
receive injuries
have a feeling

definitions.text: take vengeance on or get even
examples: We'll get them!
That'll fix him good!
This time I got him

definitions.text: achieve a point or goal
examples: Nicklaus had a 70
The Brazilian team got 4 goals
She made 29 points that day

definitions.text: cause to do; cause to act in a specified manner
examples: The ads induced me to buy a VCR
My children finally got me to buy a computer
My wife made me buy a new sofa

definitions.text: succeed in catching or seizing, especially after a chase
examples: We finally got the suspect
Did you catch the thief?

definitions.text: come to have or undergo a change of (physical features and attributes)
examples: He grew a beard
The patient developed abdominal pains
I got funny spots all over my body
Well-developed breasts

definitions.text: be stricken by an illness, fall victim to an illness
examples: He got AIDS
She came down with pneumonia
She took a chill

definitions.text: communicate with a place or person; establish communication with, as if by telephone
examples: Bill called this number and he got Mary
The operator couldn't get Kobe because of the earthquake

definitions.text: give certain properties to something
examples: get someone mad
She made us look silly
He made a fool of himself at the meeting
Don't make this into a big deal
This invention will make you a millionaire
Make yourself clear

definitions.text: move into a desired direction of discourse
examples: What are you driving at?

definitions.text: grasp with the mind or develop an understanding of
examples: did you catch that allusion?
We caught something of his theory in the lecture
don't catch your meaning
did you get it?
She didn't get the joke
I just don't get him

definitions.text: attract and fix
examples: His look caught her
She caught his eye
Catch the attention of the waiter

definitions.text: reach with a blow or hit in a particular spot
examples: the rock caught her in the back of the head
The blow got him in the back
The punch caught him in the stomach

definitions.text: reach by calculation
examples: What do you get when you add up these numbers?

definitions.text: acquire as a result of some effort or action
examples: You cannot get water out of a stone
Where did she get these news?

definitions.text: purchase
examples: What did you get at the toy store?

definitions.text: perceive by hearing
examples: I didn't catch your name
She didn't get his name when they met the first time

definitions.text: suffer from the receipt of
examples: She will catch hell for this behavior!

definitions.text: receive as a retribution or punishment
examples: He got 5 years in prison

definitions.text: leave immediately; used usually in the imperative form
examples: Scram!

definitions.text: reach and board
examples: She got the bus just as it was leaving

definitions.text: irritate
examples: Her childish behavior really get to me
His lying really gets me

definitions.text: evoke an emotional response
examples: Brahms's `Requiem' gets me every time

definitions.text: apprehend and reproduce accurately
examples: She really caught the spirit of the place in her drawings
She got the mood just right in her photographs

definitions.text: earn or achieve a base by being walked by the pitcher
examples: He drew a base on balls

definitions.text: overcome or destroy
examples: The ice storm got my hibiscus
the cat got the goldfish

definitions.text: be a mystery or bewildering to
examples: This beats me!
Got me--I don't know the answer!
a vexing problem
This question really stuck me

definitions.text: take the first step or steps in carrying out an action
examples: We began working at dawn
Who will start?
Get working as soon as the sun rises!
The first tourists began to arrive in Cambodia
He began early in the day
Let's get down to work now

definitions.text: undergo (as of injuries and illnesses)
examples: She suffered a fracture in the accident
He had an insulin shock after eating three candy bars
She got a bruise on her leg
He got his arm broken in the scuffle

definitions.text: make children
examples: Abraham begot Isaac
Men often father children but don't recognize them
